I'm Sharon Lin, a writer and software developer. I've hopped around a couple of places (New Jersey, Boston, London, San Francisco, Hong Kong) but I'm currently settled in Queens, NY.

This summer, I'll be interning with Microsoft . Previously, I was at r2c, Cisco Meraki, Lincoln Laboratory, Trail of Bits, and Tulip.

I'm in my third year at MIT where I am studying electrical engineering & computer science and film studies.

Aside from software, I enjoy traveling and writing. I've backpacked across Europe and Southeast Asia and worked as a Major League Hacking Coach, where empowered student organizers at hackathons across North America.

I write about technology for Hackaday, Hacker Noon, and Towards Data Science. Feel free to reach me at sharonl [at] mit [dot] edu.
